benchmark_details.name: LAB (Long-document Attribution Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: LAB is a benchmark consisting of 6 long document datasets with diverse tasks related to attribution, evaluating models on their ability to attribute responses and evidence extraction.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of large language models in the context of long document attribution tasks.

data.source: Compiles datasets from existing benchmarks focusing on tasks requiring attribution in long documents.
data.format: Various formats including CSV and JSON
data.annotation: Manually annotated evidence by experts and automated evaluations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using standard formulas based on model predictions and ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate improved model performance in generating attributed responses.
methodology.baseline_results: Benchmarks include existing datasets like QASPER and Natural Questions.
methodology.validation: Validated through comparative analysis against established benchmarks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Various licenses including CC BY 4.0 and MIT for datasets.
